DOC.criteria: Patient selection base ESHRE consensus group 2011 definition poor ovarian response ( POR ) ( Bologna criterion ) : At least two follow three feature must present : 1 . Advanced maternal age ( ≥40 year ) risk factor POR ; 2 . A previous POR ( ≤3 oocytes conventional stimulation protocol ) ; 3 . An abnormal ovarian reserve test ( i.e . Antral follicle count ( AFC ) < 57 follicle Antimullerian hormone ( AMH ) < 0.51.1 ng/ml ) . Two episode POR maximal stimulation sufficient define patient poor responder absence advance maternal age abnormal Ovarian reserve test ( ORT ) . By definition , term POR refers ovarian response , therefore , one stimulate cycle consider essential diagnosis POR . However , patient 40 year age abnormal ORT may classify poor responder since advanced age abnormal ORT may indicate reduce ovarian reserve act surrogate ovarian stimulation cycle . In case , patient properly define expect PORs . Women endometriosis , endocrinal problem , uterine abnormality well male azospermia .
